sections.title: References

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable since the section involves the formatting and relevance of references.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: References are listed with specific details for each source, avoiding generic references.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The section adheres to the requirement by ensuring each reference is specific and relevant.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: No overlaps with general article content detected.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable as consistency in citation format is crucial in the references section.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: Citations are generally consistent, with minor variations in journal title presentation.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The section mostly adheres to consistent formatting with minor variances.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: Consistency maintained throughout the references section.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Editors' preference can influence usage of abbreviations, making this guideline applicable.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: Both abbreviated and full journal names used without a standardized preference.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Partial adherence due to lack of standardization based on editor preferences.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: Potential overlap if applied to multiple sections needing consistent abbreviation usage.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: The citation uses DOIs, which align with the best practice of using the doi template.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: DOI links are present for all references, following best practice guidelines.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Complete adherence to the requirement as all references are linked with DOIs.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: All references appropriately include DOIs where available.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Links to full text if freely available online are a best practice in the references section.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: URLs are provided, linking to full-text sources when freely available.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The section effectively meets the requirement by linking article titles to full-text versions.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: Adding URLs enhances reference utility with no detected overlap issues.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applies as 'Retrieved on' dates are unnecessary for links to online journal editions.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No 'Retrieved on' dates present for convenience links, adhering to the guideline.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The section fully complies with the requirement by omitting unnecessary retrieval dates.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: Ensures clarity and avoids redundancy in reference formatting.

sections.meta_notes: The references section demonstrates a strong compliance with citation standards, with slight inconsistencies in journal name presentation suggesting room for standardization improvement.
